main event: An airline pilot observed a dark colored object with a blue exhaust trail passing in front of his plane at high speed, leaving an orange colored trail behind. The next day, the same pilot observed a similar object but did not remember any orange color. Another observation reported a bright light traveling at high speed and disappearing at an estimated altitude of 40,000 feet.
interesting points: The observed object was estimated to have a 200 ft long tail and was moving at a speed of 2,000 m.p.h.
Unusual activity was reported by the University of Michigan Observatory, but no radar records were found at the 20th Division radar station.
The object passed in front of the pilot's plane at a very high rate of speed and left a blue exhaust trail behind it.
The pilot observed an object about 40 feet in diameter, bright blue in color, and estimated to be at an altitude of 1,500 feet.
Other experienced pilots also reported seeing bright bluish objects at high altitudes.
sighted object: dark colored object with a blue exhaust trail, bright light traveling at high speed, bright bluish object at high altitude
witnesses: pilots from Capitol Airlines, experienced pilots
